Comments_List: I learned about the global energy lanscape, the technologies of renewable energy and the overall context in which they evolve.
Technical properties of the grid and RE techonogies
Broad insights into multiple renewable energy sectors, including the latest developments from the past 10 years.

Good overview of the state of today's energy system, including conventional turbine technologies as well as the different kinds of renewable energy that are commercially viable. Problem sets were an effective skill-building tool that helped me gain familiarity with the application of physics concepts to the technologies in question. Really useful class overall.
The knowledge is beyond my expectations. The class is well designed and we went deeper than I expected in the topics.
I expected the class to be a broad-based class - one that did not go into extreme detail with a specific type of renewable energy - and it met my expectation in that sense

I actually thought this class would be harder than it was (especially since I hadn't taken a physics class since high school); I thought the level of difficulty was appropriate for the kinds of applications of class concepts that I plan to be doing.
The class is great, well designed, full of valuable information. And the professors are great.
I quite enjoyed this course. I was an auditor, so some of the questions below dont apply to me, btw.

Stregnths
- Very insightful information provided
- Exciting topics


Weakness
- Lecture presentations can be sometimes dry

Strengths: well organized, comprehensive syntheses of all the renewable energy technologies as well as the shifting global energy mix; clear communications around problem sets, exams, and other assignments; great lecture slides and supplementary materials

Weaknesses: some lectures got a bit side-tracked and weren't as relevant as others; could have had more time in class spent on the problem-solving applications of the lecture concepts
If you are interested in energy, definitely take this class. It is important to gain such valuable knowledge.

If this is not a physics course, do not take a large amount of time calculating physics. Many slides were preceded by the phase "this isn't a advanced physics course but..." and then spent far more time on equations compared to the concepts.
this is a great class to learn about different kinds of renewable technology

If you want an overview of the engineering design, generation properties and formulas, and applications of various types of turbines, solar cells, etc. then def take this class. You don't need to be an engineer or have that background or even focus - I'm an energy policy guy

If you are at all interested in gaining a better understanding of how renewable energy technologies and systems work, I'd recommend this class; the professors were engaging and very knowledgable about the material and it was a comprehensive overview of the world's energy mix.
